name: AbortionMedicalManagement
title: Abortion, Medical Management
purpose:
(Clinical Focus: This value set identifies concepts related to medical management of abortion, encompassing all associated services and supplies used in this process, excluding the specific medications employed.),(Data Element Scope: This data element captures the use of a medical management approach for pregnancy termination. It signifies the complete course of care provided, encompassing counseling, confirmation of pregnancy, monitoring of progress, and verification of completion.),(Inclusion Criteria: This value set includes concepts representing all essential services and supplies utilized during a medical management abortion. These services encompass:

Patient counseling regarding the procedure, risks, and benefits.
Office visits for evaluation, medication administration, and monitoring.
Confirmation of pregnancy using hCG testing.
Ultrasound examinations to determine gestational age and confirm abortion completion.),(Exclusion Criteria: The specific medications used for medical management abortion are excluded from this value set. This is because medication regimens may vary based on clinical factors and practice guidelines. A separate value set focusing specifically on the medications used in this procedure would be more appropriate.

Additional Notes:

This value set emphasizes the comprehensive nature of medical management abortion, capturing all necessary services and supplies besides the medications themselves.
The inclusion criteria highlight the importance of counseling, confirmation of pregnancy, and monitoring for patient safety and successful completion of the procedure.)

concept.display: Medically induced abortion by oral ingestion of medication including all associated services and supplies (e.g., patient counseling, office visits, confirmation of pregnancy by hcg, ultrasound to confirm duration of pregnancy, ultrasound to confirm completion of abortion) except drugs

contains.display: Medically induced abortion by oral ingestion of medication including all associated services and supplies (e.g., patient counseling, office visits, confirmation of pregnancy by hcg, ultrasound to confirm duration of pregnancy, ultrasound to confirm completion of abortion) except drugs
